channel.title: How to Make my Domain Name, Server IP
channel.description:
Hello,
I was wondering if an experienced person in these forums can help me. How do I make my Server IP address the Domain Name that I have registered?
Thanks,
Peter

item.source: How to Make my Domain Name, Server IP

item.title: How to Make my Domain Name, Server IP
item.dc:creator: @jehanne jehanne
item.description:
@jehanne wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:9, topic:55376”][quote author=jehanne link=topic=78427.msg868359#msg868359 date=1170732467]

No, you just have to have the server running on your server.

what are you talking about?

@eclipse, to make people connect to 1337scape.net u have to buy the www.1337scape.net domain.
[/quote]

If you don’t understand the meaning of IP, (Not you eclipse) they are numbers that refer to physical machines on a network. If that machine is acting as a server, you will be able to send a connection request to it, and it may either accept or decline that request. By ‘acting as a server’, I mean it is actively waiting for a connection request. If you have your moparscape server running on the physical machine that is referenced by the IP, then that is the IP of the server.[/quote]

but you DO need 1337scape.net domain for connecting to a server by the ip 1337scape.net

Read full topic
item.source: How to Make my Domain Name, Server IP

item.title: How to Make my Domain Name, Server IP
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“jehanne, post:6, topic:55376”][quote author=Javacisnotrecognized link=topic=78427.msg868323#msg868323 date=1170732001]
No, you just have to have the server running on your server.
[/quote]

what are you talking about?

@eclipse, to make people connect to 1337scape.net u have to buy the www.1337scape.net domain.[/quote]

If you don’t understand the meaning of IP, (Not you eclipse) they are numbers that refer to physical machines on a network. If that machine is acting as a server, you will be able to send a connection request to it, and it may either accept or decline that request. By ‘acting as a server’, I mean it is actively waiting for a connection request. If you have your moparscape server running on the physical machine that is referenced by the IP, then that is the IP of the server.

Read full topic
